content.description: Start on a good hold about waist high to the right of the verical crack system. A couple moves to get established on the crack, then up the crack to the horizontal.
content.location: At an overhanging verical finger crack, to the right of a cave / low overhang.

content.description: Sit start under the roof. The left hand is on the slope downward slanted edge and the right hand in the corner crack. Stay low and bust out right and then follow the crack up.
content.location: Can't miss the low sit start under the roof.

content.description: Start low on a decent flat hold. Work up to get established on the flakes (crux) up to the big hold on the upper flake.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter recommended.
content.location: Below a thick flake and a curved layback crack.

content.description: Highball with a dabby mantle crux about 12 feet off the ground.Get onto the block under the roof (doesn't matter how), and make a far reach to a decent hold just over the lip, then match. Trying not to dab on the tree behind you, reach for a bad seam to the left, get your left foot on a hold around hip level, then press up off your right hand, get a high right foot, and mantle onto the slab. Match the jug rail to finish, and then downclimb off to the left of the tree.Pretty cool highball. Shame that there's a tree partly in the way. Grade might change with height/wingspan.
content.protection: Lots of pads, a couple spotters, and a big pair.
content.location: On the other side of the boulder that Crossfire is on.

content.description:
Area on right (SE) side of the Yankee Ramparts East area. 

  Problems in this area include (L to R) . . . 

 Looney Bin Traverse Smoke Em If You Got Em Army Strong Army Intelligence

  Top-Rope and Trad Lead routes here are linked from this area page under the Yankee Ramparts area of the roped-climbing section of Powerlinez on MP. The lower sections of some of those routes could perhaps be tried as bouldering problems.
